meanings.definition: A situation in which a player is forced to make a disadvantageous move because they have no other options.
meanings.sent1: In chess, zugzwangs can put a player in a tough spot.
meanings.sent2: The player found themselves in zugzwangs, having to make a move that would weaken their position.
meanings.sent3: The zugzwangs in the game made everyone laugh as the player struggled to find a good move.
meanings.sent4: Facing zugzwangs, the player felt like a trapped mouse in a corner.
meanings.sent5: The zugzwangs situation was like being stuck in quicksand, sinking with every move.

meanings.definition: The necessity of making a move in chess when it would be better to pass and make no move.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, zugzwangs force players to make moves they wish they could avoid.
meanings.sent2: In chess, zugzwangs require players to make moves even when staying still seems better.
meanings.sent3: The zugzwangs situation in the game was so absurd that it made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The zugzwangs felt like a heavy weight pressing down on the player's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The zugzwangs dilemma was like a dark cloud hanging over the player's head, demanding action.
